sentences.sentence: As Ukraine reclaims the town of Baka, the true extent of devastation is revealed three days after Russian forces pull back.

sentences.sentence: Voters in Hungary are heading to the polls as incumbent Prime Minister Viktor Orban seeks a fourth consecutive term in power. He faces a stiff challenge from the opposition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But as Moscow retreats, the trail of devastation left behind is insurmountable.

sentences.sentence: This woman carrying a bouquet of white tulips was escorted away by Russian authorities under the heavy snow in the capital Zaryady Park, a short distance from the Kremlin.

sentences.sentence: According to a new poll released by the independent, non-governmental Nevada Center, support for President Vladimir Putin is rising.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Findings showed that Putin's approval rating rose from 71% in February to 83% in March. Braving a surprise snowstorm, thousands of people in the Swiss capital Bern demand an end to Russia's war in Ukraine. Organisers say the main goal is to push Switzerland to actively engage in efforts to secure a ceasefire and a full withdrawal of Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian oligarchs have their money here in Switzerland in Swiss banks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So Switzerland is a key place to stop this war and the Swiss government must take this responsibility and freeze all the assets of Russian oligarchs who financed this bloody war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are here to demonstrate that we don't forget, that even here, far away from the conflict, we have a role to play and it's important to show it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Budapest, Ukrainian refugee mothers and their children rally one day before national elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Marching over Budapest's Elizabeth Bridge, demonstrators bring baby goods, stopping every so often to sing the Ukrainian national anthem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Polls have opened across Hungary as voters in the central European country face a choice – continue with the nationalist Prime Minister Viktor Orbán for a fourth consecutive term or seek a new path with a diverse, Western-leading coalition of opposition parties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After voting, incumbent Viktor Orban said I'm optimistic. This is a strange election. Snow is falling on April the 3rd. You rarely see that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On top of that because of the conflict in Ukraine the question of war or peace has become part of the campaign. Our position is clear. We're on the side of peace and guaranteed security. We see our rivals as dangerous. We have asked everybody to vote for the party that can guarantee peace and security." The six-party opposition have bemoaned a tight government grip on the media and massively unequal political spending on the campaign. Recent polls suggest a tight race but give the ruling Fidesz party a slight lead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's likely that undecided voters will determine who wins in Sunday's vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: About 6.5 million voters will be choosing a new president, new parliament and local authorities for the capital Belgrade and other towns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: That's what we worked for the last four or five years and we believe that we're going to continue with a great effort and of course with a great contribution to the development of this country." Opinion surveys have predicted that Zuić will win another five-year term and his right-wing Serbian Progressive Party will dominate the 250-member assembly. But analysts say opposition groups do stand a chance at winning the majority in Belgrade, a possible blow to the populists' decade-old unchallenged rule in Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis says he may travel to war-torn Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The pontiff made the announcement to a plane full of journalists en route to the island of Malta.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Postponed for two years on account of the coronavirus pandemic, the focus of the visit was supposed to be on the plight of migrants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But His Holiness did not ignore the invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: From his signature Popemobile, the head of the Roman Catholic Church greeted large crowds in Valletta before meeting President Vela and the First Lady at the Grand Master's Palace. The Pope blasted Russia's President Vladimir Putin for launching a savage war in his most critical message yet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Francis also denounced the European Union for turning away Libyan migrants and said Europe must show solidarity in welcoming them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Human rights groups have condemned the EU program which trains Libyan coastguards to patrol and stop migrant smuggling operations before bringing would-be refugees back to shore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While frontline Mediterranean countries such as Italy have backed the initiative, activists say they have documented widespread abuse in detention camps where returning migrants are being held.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: camps where returning migrants are being held.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This internet radio station in Prague is run entirely by Ukrainians, broadcasting news and music tailored to the some 300,000 refugees who arrived in the Czech Republic since the war broke out. Radio veterans are working alongside beginners, teaching them the tools of the trade and hopefully providing a little comfort along the way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Not everybody can be in the front line at war and everybody has to do what he or she can do the best.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So this is how I like cheering myself up that I'm doing my profession, I'm doing what I can do the best and this is the best way I can help our people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: One listener is 23-year-old graphic designer Sofia Medvedeva.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She discovered the radio station on a six-day drive from Ukraine to Poland with her mum and younger brother and she says she couldn't hold back her tears.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I feel like I'm not alone, that someone from Ukraine as me is listening right now, Ukraine radio, and it's just like touching me to the core.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The channel was launched by a company behind several other radio stations in the Czech Republic, working alongside the Ukrainian embassy to get everything up and running in just three weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There's only one goal, and that's to be on air for as long as needed.
